meanings.definition: Of or relating to cleanliness and health
meanings.sent1: She always keeps her kitchen hygienic by washing dishes promptly.
meanings.sent2: The hospital room was hygienic, with all surfaces disinfected regularly.
meanings.sent3: The hygienic cat insisted on grooming itself after every meal.
meanings.sent4: Her hygienic habits were like a shield against germs and illnesses.
meanings.sent5: The hygienic environment in the restaurant made dining there a pleasant experience.

meanings.sent1: The hygienic chef wore gloves while preparing food to maintain cleanliness.
meanings.sent2: The hygienic habits of the staff ensured a safe and healthy workplace.
meanings.sent3: The hygienic dog refused to play in the muddy yard.
meanings.sent4: His hygienic approach to life reflected in his spotless appearance.
meanings.sent5: The hygienic standards of the hotel were top-notch, impressing all guests.

meanings.sent1: Regular handwashing is a hygienic practice to avoid getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The hygienic measures taken by the school reduced the spread of germs.
meanings.sent3: The hygienic squirrel meticulously cleaned its fur every day.
meanings.sent4: Her hygienic lifestyle was a fortress against illnesses.
meanings.sent5: The hygienic precautions during flu season kept everyone healthy in the office.
